intro: Microsaccus javensis, commonly known as the Java microsaccus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
